page.title: 18Local Politics, Buriton
page.content: On the southern fringes of the village of Buriton lie 2 disused chalk pits. One of these, the further from the centre of the village, has for over 20 years been used as a refuse tip. In 1980 as the one pit showed signs of becoming filled, the East Hampshire District Council proposed to sell the nearer pit to Hampshire County for development as a second tip. The proposal roused a storm of protest led by Buriton Village Association. The Association pointed out that a refuse tip on the edge of the South Downs Way and bordering an area designated as being of outstanding natural beauty would rob local inhabitants and countless visitors of a much valued leisure area. It was argued that the whole local ecology might be upset. Eventually the proposal was temporarily shelved. The treat remains
